title: What would you use a robot for? - Quora

response.answer_text: I would use a robot for many applications in many fields : At home, for helping me and making my life easier : Cleaning anything automatically on a regular basisDoing laundryCooking great meals with fresh foodManaging the fridge and buying food when missingHelping me on DIY stuffConnecting to the Internet to provide me information and help when I need itAt work, for being more productive, and remove danger from tasks : Automating repetitive and boring tasksHelping people for heavy lifting and dangerous tasksAt school, for giving a better technology education : Providing nice interface for children and students to learn technology, programming, and roboticsAllowing students to work on much better projects, because when the robot you are programming is working, it is much more rewarding than just a log line on a screen.

Definitely for speed.Robots are not limited by muscle strength or stamina so production of goods could be a place for them but that would take hundreds and thousands of jobs.. Maybe robots have a place among us, working on projects in space, Antarctica or Deserts?A role as scout on our own planet could be useful too, scanning the earth for minerals or lost secrets? If it comes to the standard guy, it would replace people for more $$$ but if it comes toa scientist or someone with vision, then it would probably be to co-operate with us by doing the things we can’t without month’s of preparation like journeys to harsh terrains perhaps?
